channel.title: Digital Notebook NonNeutralZero
channel.description: Recent content on Digital Notebook NonNeutralZero

item.description:
Logistic Regression as a Neural Network #

Architecture #

𝐺𝑖𝑣𝑒𝑛 𝑥 , 𝑦̂ = 𝑃(𝑦 = 1|𝑥), where 0 ≤ 𝑦̂ ≤ 1

Parameters of logistic regression

  1. Input observation,features matrix X
  2. Target vector Y
  3. Weights w
  4. Threshold or bias b
  5. Output: 𝑦̂, sigmoid(z) where z = 𝑤 𝑇 *𝑥 + 𝑏

To get the parameters w and b (i.e. learning), we optimize on:

𝐽(𝑤, 𝑏) = 1/m (∑ 𝐿(𝑦̂ (𝑖) , 𝑦 (𝑖) ))

NOPROP #

NOPROP: TRAINING NEURAL NETWORKS WITHOUT BACK-PROPAGATION OR FORWARD-PROPAGATION

Qinyu Li, Yee Whye Teh, Razvan Pascanu (arxiv) arXiv:2503.24322
